page.title: 19A Smallholding 2
page.content: As well as having hens, Mr. Howard has a nursery at{Lees Barn}where he grows various vegetables. His main crops are runner-beans, cabbage, beetroot, turnips, radish and other kinds of vegetables. The crops need quite a lot of attention especially if the weather is too hot or too dry or very cold. When it is time to harvest the produce Mr. Howard is very busy getting the vegetables ready to be sold at the market. Two goats are also kept at the smallholding. They give three and a half pints of milk a day. Soon they will have a kid. Three pigs, a dog and three cats also live at Lees Barn.
